page.title: 01HUCKNALL - AN OUTLINE
page.content: {Hucknall}is a small market town in central{Nottinghamshire}with a {population of 28,000.}It is situated at the southern end of the{Pennines and in the{Leen Valley.}It is part of {Ashfield District Council and Sherwood {Parliamentary Constituency.}The town itself is centred around the{market {place and Parish Church. Hucknall developed as a{coal mining}town and {textiles and engineering}have become important{industries}in recent years. Post-1945, there has been much residential development making Hucknall a{dormitory town of {Nottingham.Famous local people include {the poet Lord Byron who is buried in {the Parish Church and the composer {Eric Coates}who was born in the town in 1886. Centenary celebrations will take place next year.
